node.title: A 73-Point Loser Is Not ‘Necessarily’ Who the Thunder Are
node.description: In a 152-79 loss, a rebuilding Oklahoma City team took record-setting lumps from the Memphis Grizzlies.

node.title: 6-Year-Old Boy, Caught in International Custody Battle, Is Expected to Return to Italy
node.description: Eitan Biran, who lost his parents in a cable car crash in Italy this year, had been taken to Israel by his grandfather.

node.title: As Vaccine Mandates Move Forward, 1 in 4 Republicans Say They Will Never Get Shot
node.description: Only 2 percent of Democrats said they definitely wouldn't get the vaccine, while 91 percent have already received at least one dose.

node.title: What Polls Say About Support for Stacey Abrams as She Runs for Georgia Governor Again
node.description: Recent polls suggest that the Democratic activist faces a tough campaign.

node.title: The Great Resignation Won’t Last Forever
node.description: The Great Resignation won’t last forever: Americans are waiting for the right opportunity to jump back into the work force.

node.title: Memory, That Unreliable Narrator: New Science Fiction and Fantasy
node.description: Seven books comb through history, travel to distant planets and imagine our A.I. future.

node.title: Best TV Shows of 2021
node.description: From Bo Burnham to “We Are Lady Parts,” the best in television this year offered ingenuity, humor, defiance and hope.

node.title: On Japan’s Pacific Coast, an Artist Communes With Nature
node.description: At his retreat near Isumi, Kazunori Hamana creates humble yet imposing ceramic vessels that evoke the world around him.

node.title: Why Do Christmas Trees Cost More This Year?
node.description: There are fewer tree farms these days, and some were hit by severe weather. Plus, both real and fake trees have been affected by higher shipping costs.

node.title: Why Dave Chappelle's School Made a Sharp U-Turn in Naming Controversy
node.description: The Duke Ellington School of the Arts postponed its decision to name a theater after the comedian amid the controversy surrounding his Netflix special.

node.title: Woman Reveals How She Walks Down Her Dangerous 'Death Stairs' Built in 1890
node.description: The house in Virginia was built in 1775, with the servant stairs added later in 1890.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Some Americans Will Be Eligible for $1,400 Payment in 2022
node.description: Payments will be issued after a person files their taxes in 2021.

node.title: Hiring stalled in November, with economy adding 210,000 jobs
node.description: Job growth fell far short of expectations and represents a sharp slowdown from hiring in October.

node.title: A Christmas party in Norway becomes a possible Omicron-spreading event.
node.description: All those infected were fully vaccinated and tested before entering a restaurant in central Oslo, where one traveler from South Africa carried the new variant.

node.title: California’s Western Monarch Butterflies Are Making a Comeback
node.description: The “close to miraculous” rebound feels like a reprieve from dire news about climate change.

node.title: Omicron variant may increase risk of COVID reinfection, study finds
node.description: New research fuels calls in rich nations for people to get booster shots, while African scientists warn that without vaccine equity, this will just keep happening

node.title: Serena Williams publishing first children's book
node.description: Qai Qai the doll has brought joy to people on social media for years, from her meeting "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King to "camping" out at the 2019 Met Gala.

node.title: "I didn't try to kill my brother" Years later, girl adopted from Russia speaks out
node.description: She was returned to Russia, and left in a children's psychiatric hospital. Now, her astonishing story.

node.title: The New Rules for Hosting That Holiday Party
node.description: If the 2020 holiday season was the year to cancel everything, 2021 is about figuring out how to get our groove back.

node.title: Vaccine Campaigns Are Built on Trust. In Some Places, It Is in Short Supply.
node.description: Vaccine hesitancy reflects a transformation of people’s core beliefs about what we owe each other.

node.title: Emaciated Dog Abandoned Last Christmas 'Totally Different' After Finding Forever Home
node.description: "She won't leave my side. I've definitely found a best friend for life; and she has too!" the dog's new owner said.

node.title: Family Told COVID Wouldn't Affect Newborn Baby By Doctors Lose Son to Virus
node.description: Californian couple Tyler Redondo and Angelina Redondo, the parents of three-month-old Tyler, want to use their experience to warn other parents about COVID.

node.title: What Is Black Xmas? BLM Holds Annual Christmas Boycott of 'White Companies'
node.description: The protest movement is calling for people to support Black-owned businesses this festive period and "shake off the chains of consumerism."

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Stared Directly at Her Court Sketch Artist and Drew Them Right Back
node.description: The image has gone viral on social media, with some Twitter users describing the image as "terrifying" and "horrific."

node.title: Tasmanian JackJumpers claim thrilling win over Brisbane Bullets in NBL debut
node.description: The Tasmania JackJumpers score a thrilling nine-point overtime win over the Brisbane Bullets in their maiden NBL match in Hobart.

node.title: Omicron: What we know - and don't know - about the new COVID variant
node.description: President Biden said he plans to outline a new strategy on Thursday to curb the virus this winter.

node.title: The Canonization of Saint John Coltrane
node.description: The intensity of the jazz legend’s music has always inspired passion, but in the 1960s, one group of devotees was so stirred they founded a church in his name.

node.title: Lakers Search for Answers, With and Without LeBron James
node.description: James could miss multiple games because of coronavirus protocols, but the Lakers have struggled even when he has played.

node.title: English Teenager Finds Bronze Age Ax Using a Metal Detector
node.description: On her third day out with a metal detector, Milly Hardwick, 13, found a hoard of items from more than 3,000 years ago. “We were just laughing our heads off,” she said.

node.title: COVID Vaccine Compulsory for More Than 200 Million People Worldwide
node.description: On November 23, Austria became the first Western democracy and European Union member state to announce mandatory vaccination.
